If you’re experiencing fear while listening to a politician, “It is important to understand that many statements made by politicians and candidates are made for strategic reasons that extend beyond changing your vote to demobilizing the electorate,” says Huddy (Political Psychology, Vol. 32, No. 3, 2011).

DARK TRIAD TRAIT
in 2010, Dr Peter Jonason, then assistant professor of psychology at the University of Western Florida, and his co-author, Gregory Webster, assistant professor of psychology at the University of Florida, developed the "Dirty Dozen" rating scale, or a 12-item methodology, to measure Dark Triad traits. [1]

Jonason and Webster's measure asks people to rate themselves against these questions:

I tend to manipulate others to get my way.
I have used deceit or lied to get my way.
I have used flattery to get my way.
I tend to exploit others towards my own end.
I tend to lack remorse.

Why does modernization only apply to boys and not girls?

Girls in Delhi government schools typically wear salwar suits due to cultural norms, traditions, and perceived practicality, while boys wear shirts and pants. This disparity highlights a lack of gender equality in uniform policies, where modernization often favors boys. Un logo ko itna lachar bana diya gaya hai ki aaye din koi bhi un logo par atyachar karta hai. Inki koi bhi mang ya koi bhi baat vibhag me nahi mani jati aur un logo ko tala diya jata hai kisi bhi karya ko lekar. Vaise to bahut sari scheems dikhai jati hai agr Google kiya jaye to, magar 95% scheems ko sirf dikhane ke liye hi hai, unka Labh nahi mil pata hai. Divya jan apni marriage nahi kar pata hai kyuki unke pas kamai ke liye koi sadhan nahi hota hai. Rojgar vo kar nahi sakte hai. Rojgar ke liye sirf 10k ka loan provide kiya jata hai jo ki koi mayene nahi rakhta hai kisi bhi startup ko start karne ke liye. Aur kisi state me 5 hundreds aur kisi state me 1k aur kisi me 1.5k Pension di jati hai😢 jisse koi bhi Divyang jan marriage karna to door, apni family chalana to door apna bhi pet nahi pal sakta jo ki bahut hi chinta ka vishay hai. Divyang jano ke liye koi bhi awaj nahi uthata hai, kya Divyang hona koi gunah hai ? 😢😢😢😢 Jitne bhi india me Divyang jan hai apse vinati karte hai ki ek video divyang jan ki problems ko lekar bhi banaya jaye kisse Divyang jano ko bhi labh mile or vo bhi apni family banaye ... Somehow they appear exactly when the actor comes out lol its understanding between paps and actors to never reveal that the celebs PAY them. Even the biggest stars. The paps always say they follow celebs etc.. BIG LIES.  The PR teams tell them the place and time. Thats the secret. So many times we go to airports, never seen paps stationed 24/7...means the manager/PR team is always updating the pap teams,  when the stars want to be photographed. If stars dont want, we dont see anything about that actor. Sunil shetty openly asked the paps 'toh PR ne inform kardiya aap ko. sab  aagaye' 😆😂 Also as you pointed out, its the actors PR teams only who also mention the caption also. Many of these PR companies also seem to scam the people they are employing to promote the companies who have created a contract with them to boost their popularity online. Nowadays so many freshers are going around looking for part time jobs and their social media is full of targeted ads telling them that they only need to spend 10-30 minutes in a day for this job, where they ask you to first deposit a sum of money after which you start getting "paid". But the moment you want to stop, they hack your bank account and remove all your money. Happened to a close friend of mine recently, and he lost Rs.16000. This entire social media frenzy is a highly dangerous environment to be in.

Dear Global Citizens and Dhruv bhai,
We, the students of Bangladesh, are crying out for your support as we face a grave crisis. In our quest for fair and just quota reforms, we have been met with unimaginable brutality from the Chhatra League, a government-affiliated student organization. Our peaceful protests have turned into scenes of horror, with nearly 1000 of us injured and many of our friends and fellow students losing their lives. At least 30-40 students have been killed by Bangladesh police and the Chhatra League. We want justice.
The state-controlled media has turned a blind eye to our suffering, silencing our voices and hiding the truth from the world. Seeking freedom and justice has become a crime in our beloved country, and we are being punished for daring to dream of a better future.
We urge you to stand with us, to share our story, and to demand justice. Let the world know the truth about our struggle. We need your voice to amplify ours, to show that we are not alone in this fight for fairness and human rights.
Together, we can expose the injustice and bring about the change we so desperately need.
Please, help us spread the truth and seek justice for the students of Bangladesh.

Subject: Urgent Exposing Student Torture by Government Officials at Dhaka University 

Dear Dhruv Rathe

I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to you because we are in desperate need of your help.

Recently, students at our university have been subjected to severe torture and harassment by government officials and student politicians. This situation has created an atmosphere of fear and oppression, and many of us feel powerless to change it.

We believe that your platform could bring much-needed attention to our plight. Your influence and ability to reach millions could help expose these atrocities and potentially bring about change. We kindly ask if you could make a video or post about our situation to shed light on what is happening here.

We would be incredibly grateful if you could use your platform to help us. Your support could make a significant difference in our fight for justice and safety.

Thank you for considering our request. Please let us know if you need any further information or if there are other ways we can assist you in covering this issue.

Sincerely

Dear Dhruv Rathee,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention a critical and distressing situation unfolding in Bangladesh. As an influential voice, I believe you can help amplify our struggle for justice and equality.

In Bangladesh, the quota system provides significant advantages to individuals whose fathers or grandfathers were freedom fighters, granting them preferential treatment in jobs, university admissions, and other opportunities. Currently, there are 36 such quotas in place. While the intention behind this system might have been noble, it has led to widespread discrimination and injustice against many students and job candidates who do not have such lineage.

As a result, students across the nation have risen in protest, demanding a fair and merit-based system. Unfortunately, our government has responded with extreme measures. The ruling party's student wing, Chhatra League, along with the police, have resorted to violence to suppress these peaceful protests. Innocent students, including girls, are being beaten, with bloodshed now a common sight in colleges and universities.

We urgently need international attention and support to bring about change. Your voice can make a significant difference in highlighting our plight and pressuring the authorities to address our concerns fairly and justly.

Thank you for your time and consideration. We hope you will stand with us in our fight for a just and equitable system.

I am writing to bring to your urgent attention to a grave incident involving the torture of students by the Bangladesh government during the recent quota movement.

The students were peacefully protesting against the government's quota system when they were subjected to severe violence by the authorities. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Dear Dhruv Rathe,

I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to you because we are in desperate need of your help.

Your dedication to exposing the truth and fighting for justice has inspired millions, including many of us here in Bangladesh. Your work has made a tremendous impact, not only in your country but across the globe. We are huge fans and loyal subscribers of your channel, deeply moved by your commitment to standing up against injustice.

Recently, students at Dhaka University have been subjected to severe torture and harassment by government officials and student politicians. This situation has created an atmosphere of fear and oppression, leaving many of us feeling powerless and desperate for change.

We believe that your powerful voice and platform could bring much-needed attention to our plight. Your influence could help expose these atrocities and potentially bring about the change we so desperately need. We humbly ask if you could make a video or post about our situation to shed light on what is happening here.

Your support would mean the world to us. It could make a significant difference in our fight for justice and safety. We know that with your help, our cries for help could reach a wider audience and compel those in power to take action.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for considering our request. Please let us know if you need any further information or if there are other ways we can assist you in covering this issue.

Sincerely,
Shakib

Dear Dhruv Rathee,I hope this message finds you well. I am a student from Bangladesh and a regular viewer of your insightful videos. I am writing to bring to your attention a serious issue that is currently affecting students at Dhaka University.

Recently, students have been protesting against the quota system in government jobs, where nearly 52% of the positions are reserved for certain groups, leaving little opportunity for meritorious candidates. In response to their demand for quota system reform, the Student League and police attacked the protesting students on July 15th. This attack resulted in several injuries and even fatalities among the students.

As someone who values your efforts in raising awareness about important social issues, I believe that your coverage of this matter could significantly help in bringing it to light and pushing for positive change.

Your assistance and voice in this matter would be greatly appreciated by many who are suffering in silence. Thank you in advance for considering this request.

Best regards,

Dear Dhruv Rathee,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to you as a devoted subscriber from Bangladesh who deeply appreciates your efforts to highlight injustices and important social issues through your YouTube channel.

Currently, Bangladesh is facing a significant issue regarding the government's decision to allocate around 53% of government jobs to various quotas, including the Freedom Fighters' quota, Disability quota, and Women's quota. This decision has sparked widespread protests among the general student population, who view this quota system as discriminatory.

On July 15th, students from Dhaka University and other universities across the country protested against this unfair quota system. Unfortunately, these peaceful protests were met with brutal attacks by members of the Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL). Many students were injured, including over 150 individuals, with several female students being assaulted.

As a prominent voice against injustice, I believe that your platform could significantly amplify the plight of these students and bring international attention to their cause. I am also providing some photos that capture the extent of the torture inflicted on the protesting students by the BCL members.

Your coverage of this issue could help raise awareness and support for the affected students and potentially drive meaningful change. I sincerely hope you consider creating a video on this critical topic.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,

[Your Name].

Dhaka,Bangladesh.

Please save Bangladeshi students

Dear Dhruv Rathee,
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to you as a devoted subscriber from Bangladesh who deeply appreciates your efforts to highlight injustices and important social issues through your YouTube channel.
Currently, Bangladesh is facing a significant issue regarding the government's decision to allocate around 53% of government jobs to various quotas, including the Freedom Fighters' quota, Disability quota, and Women's quota. This decision has sparked widespread protests among the general student population, who view this quota system as discriminatory.
On July 15th, students from Dhaka University and other universities across the country protested against this unfair quota system. Unfortunately, these peaceful protests were met with brutal attacks by members of the Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL). Many students were injured, including over 150 individuals, with several female students being assaulted.
As a prominent voice against injustice, I believe that your platform could significantly amplify the plight of these students and bring international attention to their cause. I am also providing some photos that capture the extent of the torture inflicted on the protesting students by the BCL members.
Your coverage of this issue could help raise awareness and support for the affected students and potentially drive meaningful change. I sincerely hope you consider creating a video on this critical topic.
Thank you for your time and consideration.
Best regards,
[Joy Paul].
Dhaka,Bangladesh.

Dear Dhruv Sir,
I'm a regular student of Bangladesh now studying at the Jahangirnagar University  which is a reputed public university in our nation. Recently a student movement has started in our country based on the QUOTA reform. Government aren't showing any concern regarding our demands. A big violence has happened today between Bangladesh students league (It's a student based organization which is committed to the government and doing illegal activities for years) and general students. Nearly five hundred students (including women) are injured and are admitted in different hospitals due to the attack. They're trying to prevent the movement by attacking the students. Our universities also aren't helping us against these injustice. Police and media are in the control of the government so we're not getting any help from them. We've really become helpless. 
May I therefore request you to inspect the situation in your own way and make a video indicating the wrongdoings of our government. We respect you and believe in your integrity towards the righteous.

Dear Dhruv Rathee,

I hope this email finds you well. I am one of your big fans from Bangladesh, and I admire your work greatly.

Currently, our country is facing a significant crisis. Since our independence, a freedom fighter quota has been in place. While it was initially intended for the children of those who fought in the war, it has now extended to their grandchildren and beyond, which is highly illogical. This quota system has severely impacted the job market for the general population. As a result, people are protesting to abolish this system. 

Unfortunately, various political groups, such as members of the Bangladesh student's League, are violently attacking the protesters. The government is not taking any action to address this issue.

I am reaching out to request your assistance in studying this matter and raising awareness about it. Your support could make a significant difference. Please do not ignore this urgent issue. Any help you can provide from your position would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
[Your audience from Bangladesh ]

 Currently, private telecom companies like Jio, Airtel and VI are offering 5G services and raising recharge prices arbitrarily, causing inconvenience to the common man.  On the other hand, government SIM recharge prices like BSNL are very low, yet they are not able to provide even 4G services. 

 Our question is, can't the government improve BSNL?  If BSNL can offer 5G services and keep pace with current technology, people will benefit. 

 Want your valuable views and a video in this regard, where you discuss the solution to this problem and what the government should do.

1. "And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, and is a believer, then We will give him life, and We will give them their reward according to the best of what they used to do." (Quran 16:97)

2. "Verily, in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find peace." (Quran 13:28)

3. "And Allah calls to the Home of Peace, and guides whom He wills to a straight path." (Quran 10:25)

4. "And the believers will say, 'This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us, and He has told the truth. And it is only Allah Who has made us victorious over them, and to Allah we are grateful.'" (Quran 33:22)

5. "And those who believe and do good deeds, We will admit them among the righteous. And We will grant them a good life, and We will give them a good reward." (Quran 16:115)

6. "And Allah will reward them for what they have been doing, with gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. And that is the great success." (Quran 9:89)

These verses emphasize the importance of leading a righteous life, remembering Allah, and following His guidance to achieve peace and happiness in this life and the hereafter.

ഞാൻ മാത്രം ആണോ ഇപ്പൊ ജയറാം ഓർക്കുന്നത്

*ध्रुव राठी के बारे में ब्रेकिंग ट्रुथ* जो हिंदू का मुखौटा पहनकर मोदी-विरोधी, बीजेपी-विरोधी, आरएसएस-विरोधी और सनातन विरोधी अफवाहें चलाता है (कोई माहेश्वरी नहीं है)।

उनका असली नाम बदरू रशीद, पूरा नाम बदरुद्दीन रशीद लाहौरी है। 

*उनका जन्म लाहौर, पाकिस्तान में हुआ था और उनकी पत्नी जूली (ईसाई लगने वाला नाम) भी पाकिस्तानी हैं, जिनका असली नाम ज़ुलेखा (स्पष्ट रूप से मुस्लिम नाम) है।*

*वे कराची में विश्व प्रसिद्ध और कुख्यात गैंगस्टर दाऊद इब्राहिम के गुप्त अलीशान बंगले में रहते हैं जहां उन्हें आईएसआई और पाकिस्तानी सेना की Y+ और Z+ सुरक्षा प्रदान की जाती है।*

*बदरू रशीद (ध्रुव राठी के रूप में फर्जीवाड़ा) की फंडिंग पाकिस्तान, चीन, दुबई, मालदीव, कनाडा, रूस, तुर्की और पेंडोरा से होती है।*

*मोदी का विरोध करने के लिए जॉर्ज सोरोस के खाते से पेसा को फंड भेजा जाता है।*

*लेकिन अब इस हिंदू विरोधी भारत विरोधी तत्व का भंडाफोड़ हो गया है*।

इस बात का खुलासा इजरायली खुफिया एजेंसी *मोसाद* ने अपनी खुफिया रिपोर्ट में किया है। 

सभी *सनातनी* कृपया इस खुलासे को अधिक से अधिक शेयर करें और *बदरू रशीद*❕ की सच्चाई बताएं

यह जो भी लोग इसको फॉलो कर रहे हैं सब अंधभक्त हैं खुद। यह बंदा इतने अच्छे से इन सब का ब्रेनवाश कर रहा है लेकिन इनमें से किसी को भी बुद्धि नहीं खुलने वाली। 
आज ही आपको नहीं दिख रहा है यह हमेशा सेंट्रल गवर्नमेंट पर जो कटाक्ष करता रहता है उनकी कमियां निकलता है अब यह जाकर यह क्यों नहीं कह रहा इस चीज में वीडियो क्यों नहीं बना रहा कि वेस्ट बंगाल में जो स्थिति अभी हो रही है उसको देखते हुए सेंट्रल गवर्नमेंट को वहां पर प्रेसिडेंट रूल लागू करवा देना चाहिए इस बात का वीडियो यह बंदा कभी नहीं बनाएगा क्योंकि यह खुद जर्मनी में बैठा है इसको क्या पता कि भारत देश के हालात कहां पर क्या है कैसे रहना है इसको सिर्फ अपने व्यूज चाहिए।😊 और कांग्रेस का चमचा बनने के अलावा इसके पास और कोई काम नहीं ।उसको पता है कि मोदी विरोधी वीडियो बनाकर ही इसको इसको फेम मिलेगा इसलिए यह नाटक चल रहा है इसका। कन्वर्जन को लेकर यह किस तरीके से मुसलमान और क्रिश्चियन लोग जबरदस्ती धर्म परिवर्तन करवा रहे हैं उसके बारे में यह कभी भी कोई भी वीडियो नहीं बनाएगा क्योंकि इसमें हिम्मतहै ही नहीं। संभल जाओ देशवासियों, ऐसे लोग किसी के नहीं होते। और यह क्या देशभक्ति के नारे लगा रहा है यह खुद तो जर्मनी में बैठा है इसको क्या पता कि घर में क्या हो रहा है। बहती गंगा में हाथ धोना इसको कहते हैं। क्योंकि कांग्रेस के राज में अगर यह ऐसे सवाल पूछता तो इसका अता पता नहीं रहता इसको कब गायब करवा देते किसी को भी पतानहीं चलता। जिसने 2014 से पहले कभी राज अच्छे से नोटिस किया होगा उसको पता है कि कितने रिपोर्टर्स गायब हो चुके हैं सिर्फ इसकी वजह से की क्योंकि उन्होंने उसे समय की सरकार के खिलाफ आवाज उठाई थी। यह पश्चिम बंगाल की टॉपिक पर भी बात नहीं करेगा क्योंकि उसको पता है कि इसको मरवा दियाजाएगा। जिगर चाहिए सही और गलत में फैसला करने के लिए और उसके ऊपर वीडियो बनाने के लिए यह सिर्फ मोदी विरोधी है और देश विरोधी है इसके अलावा इसका कोई वजूद है नहीं।

The glamorous world of Bollywood celebrities is often a facade, with paid social media trends, fake box office numbers, and questionable award shows. The authentic aspects of their lives are vastly overshadowed by paid promotions and PR stunts.


Key moments:
01:29 Celebrities often create a glamorous image on social media, but the reality behind their glamorous world may not always be true. The term 'Paparazzi' originated from a character in an Italian film in the 1960s, known for being intrusive but fearless in capturing celebrities.
          -The influence of paparazzi on celebrities' lives and the portrayal of their glamorous world on social media. 
          -The origin of the term 'Paparazzi' from an Italian film character and their role in capturing celebrities' lives. 
05:27 Celebrity culture has evolved with social media, impacting authenticity and publicity. Some celebrities seek paid publicity, while others maintain authenticity without the need for promotion.
          -Evolution of celebrity culture with the advent of social media and its impact on authenticity and publicity.
          -Distinction between celebrity models seeking paid publicity and authentic celebrities unaffected by the need for promotion.
08:09 Identifying fake accounts on social media that post regularly about Bollywood and celebrities can be challenging. Many posts are often PR-driven with paid promotions, like the case of a Bollywood post being copied and pasted, then corrected later.
          -Importance of scrutinizing social media posts for authenticity, especially in the realm of Bollywood and celebrity promotions.
          -The prevalence of PR-driven content and paid promotions on social media platforms, showcasing the need for critical evaluation of posts.
12:10 The credibility of award shows in the film industry is questioned due to practices like buying and selling awards, impacting the authenticity of recognitions. Influencer awards also face scrutiny, with categories seemingly created to distribute awards widely.
          -Impact of corporate bookings on box office numbers and audience presence in Bollywood films discussed.
          -Discussion on the practice of self-booking and corporate bookings to manipulate box office collections and award nominations.
16:13 Celebrities use various tactics to protect their privacy, including editing and controlling the release of their photos and videos. Some fans take extreme actions due to their obsession with celebrities, leading to dangerous consequences.
          -Celebrities in Bollywood and Hollywood maintain their privacy by controlling their photos and videos before releasing them to the public.
          -Some fans go to extreme lengths, like setting themselves on fire, due to their obsession with celebrities and the fake glamorous image portrayed in the media.
